DOC.brief_title: Using Behavioral Programs Treat Sleep Problems Individuals With Alzheimer 's Disease
DOC.detailed_description: Nocturnal disturbance , get bed repeatedly , hallucination , talk sing bed , wake confused common among patient AD . Such nocturnal disturbance associate increased physical psychological morbidity AD patient caregiver major risk factor patient institutionalization . Nonpharmacologic treatment disturbance need . This study assign AD patient one four different treatment determine effective reduce nocturnal disturbance . This study last 6 month . Participants randomly assign walk program , light exposure program , `` NITE-AD '' program , combine walk light exposure program , routine AD care nocturnal disturbance education . Walking program participant three 1-hour visit therapist 8-week period . The therapist participant set initial daily walk goal develop plan gradually increase participant ' walk 30 minutes/day , increase participant-selected pace . Pedometers give participant monitor daily activity . The therapist also discuss exercise safety review way prevent muscle soreness . Light program participant also three 1-hour visit therapist 8 week . The therapist develop daily , caregiver-supervised light exposure plan require participant sit front light box 1 hour every day . NITE-AD program participant six 1-hour visit therapist 8 week ; visit include set walk light exposure routine . Participants assigned education receive information sleep age dementia , assistance set walk light exposure plan . Participants assess study entry Months 2 ( post-test ) 6 . The sleep pattern patient caregiver measure . Caregiver report patient ' night-time behavioral disturbance reading actigraph , small electronic device wear participant record report level activity night , use estimate sleep . The study also collect data patient caregiver mood , stress , behavior . A follow-up visit occur 6 month study completion ; follow-up visit , outcome measure collect baseline post-test . Participants receive 3 biannual phone follow-up ( 12 , 18 , 24 month ) assess patient residential status caregiver report patient caregiver sleep .
